title: C2C: Country To Country
description:
Country superstars are joining forces for the first time in London to create C2C: Country to Country.

Some of the biggest names in the business are heading across the Atlantic for a huge two-day music festival extravaganza at The O2 London in March 2013.

The spirit of Nashville is set to be captured in The O2 with a number of pop up stages and The Town Square – a bespoke retail area – being created as part of the Country to Country festival.

These pop up stages, which will be open from midday, will offer free performances, showcasing emerging country artistes, while The Town Square will feature a whisky bar, Country to Country festival merchandise, various market traders and live music including an eclectic line up of DJs.

Both the pop up stages and The Town Square entertainment is in addition to the stellar line up of some of the biggest names in country, who will be performing in The O2 arena.

Bob Harris will Bob Harris will be hosting / compere-ing both days over the course of the festival, and highlights of the C2C: Country To Country Festival will be broadcast on his BBC Radio 2 show on Sunday 24 & 31 March 2013.

Saturday 16th March 2013
Main Stage: Doors 4.00pm | Curfew 11.00pm | First Act on at 4.45pm

Tim McGraw
Vince Gill
Little Big Town
Kristian Bush (of Sugarland)

Sunday 17th March 2013
Main Stage: Doors 3.30pm | Curfew 10.30pm | First Act on at 4.15pm

Carrie Underwood
Darius Rucker
LeAnn Rimes
Brantley Gilbert

Saturday 16th & Sunday 17th March 2013
Pop-Up Stages: Town Square Stage, Pizza Express Stage, O2 Shop Stage | 12-7pm

Raintown
Robert Vincent
Jill Johnson
Dean Owens
The Good Intentions
Ags Connolly
Raevennan Husbandes
The Robbie Boyd Band
James Riley
Alan West

*Artists performing on the pop-up stages will perform once a day on each of the three stages, on both days (three performances a day in total, six over the entirety of the festival).

The sound of Nashville at the world’s most popular venue marks a major milestone in the UK’s love of country, where major US artists sell out arenas around the country.

The likes of LeAnn Rimes and Carrie Underwood have a massive effect on both the UK and US charts, echoing the traditional sounds of the greatest country singers, while appealing to modern day listeners. Carrie Underwood’s sell out London performance last summer was the latest milestone and illustrated the UK’s huge appetite for the new sounds of country.

Artist fan club and o2 priority pre-sale from 9am on Wednesday 5 December 2012, general tickets on-sale at 9am on Friday 7 December 2012.
